## Setup workspace

- If you happen to use [Debian Linux (KDE)](https://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/current-live/amd64/iso-hybrid/), which is my wife's least hated linux distro, you may use "[**MyWorkspace**](https://github.com/chenh19/MyWorkspace)" to configure the entire workspace:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
bash <(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chenh19/MyWorkspace/main/setup.sh)
```

- If you use other Unix/Linux systems, you may use "[**git_ssh**](https://github.com/chenh19/git_ssh)" to connect to GitHub with SSH:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
bash <(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chenh19/git_ssh/main/gitssh.sh)
```

-  and use "[**alt_rm**](https://github.com/chenh19/alt_rm)" to replace the default ```rm``` just in case:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
bash <(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chenh19/alt_rm/main/install.sh)
```

## Clone the Quarto template

- In a desired directory, clone the Quarto template repository:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
git clone https://github.com/chenh19/Quarto.git
```

- Rename the repository as you like:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
mv Quarto <Project> && cd <Project> && rm -rf .git %% git init
```

- Connect this local repository with your GitHub:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
git remote add origin git@github.com:<user>/<repository.git>
```

- Render the modified ```.Rmd/.qmd/.ipynb``` files:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
quarto render analysis
```

- Commit and push to your GitHub:

```{bash, eval=FALSE}
git add --all && git commit -a -m "update" && git push -u origin main
```
